page.title: 10FARMING,Pennyland,Yeoford.
page.content: {Pennyland}is a farm on the road to {Colebrooke}from{Yeoford.The}family work and live on the farm.{Pennyland} farm is a pig farm.They keep their pigs in sheds.Most of the old sheds on the farm have been replaced with modern sheds but one old shed still stands.It is about 200 years old.It is made out of cob and wood.The owners use lots of machinery for growing and harvesting crops.The farmhouse and farm have been in the family for 28 years.The family own 1000 pigs.They feed their pigs on barley and wheat.They feed their pigs at 7.30am and 4.00pm.The pigs have piglets twice a year.The piglets are seperated from their mothers at five weeks old. On this farm the pigs are kept in sheds. They use their land for growing crops.They grow barley, wheat and oats. We all enjoyed our visit.
